intro: Dalechampia triphylla f. pohliana, commonly known as the Pohliana variant of the three-leaf dalechampia, is a flowering plant native to tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its palmate leaves with three lobes. The plant produces small, inconspicuous flowers that are typically clustered in inflorescences. It is often cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its distinctive foliage. The f. pohliana form is distinguished by its more compact growth habit and slightly different leaf morphology compared to the typical species.
